title: ARAM : Limiting champ selection pool to mastery 4 or less.
body:
(please read this carefully before commenting or down voting it. I had to recreate the post  as people were miss reading it, assuming wrong thing and  then down voting the idea. Then other people down voting it   based on the misunderstood post of others, while up voting the misunderstanding. )  


*** This is for a user enabled/disabled feature. You would enable or disable this when you feel like it.  ***
*** You  want to level mastery on champs that you haven't mastered  - enable it.   ***
*** You want to play all your champs - disable the feature.  ***
Hence it will not impact your current game play in ARAM if you don't want it to. 


Would be great if you can add an option in ARAM  for players to enable or  disable champs with mastery 5 or higher from the ARAM selection. I don't SR, but it would be cool if i can get to play some of the champs I don't have high mastery on, without having to leave the ARAM queue .


if you eventually get to a few  <5 master champs,  this will severely limit the feature when enabled, giving you the advantage of playing the same few champs over and over, hence you can pad the small champ selection pool with mastery 5 champs.
example:  if you fall under 10 champs (arbitrary # , can be 15 or 20.. )  with mastery level 4 or less.. then throw in some random mastery 5 or higher champs to increase the random selection pool size to 10 champs.

What do you all think ?

replies.body: lol getting the same champ 3 times in one night when it is not even on rotation is not random either. lol Its no different than having a smurf account, only different is that when you enable it, you are playing with champs you are NOT good with, where as a smurf account gives a person champs they are good with. Heck even limit the re-roll points you collect based on the champ pool size you are limited too.

Heck even limit the re-roll points you collect based on the champ pool size you are limited too.

Yes, it is random. Humans have great difficulty with spotting randomness when we see it, often finding patterns where none exist.

Except it is random. 

It's just based off of the current last 3 champion pools.

it could work if there was something "works only if number of champions with mastery 4 and lower is less than X"

And X is debatable. I'd say 40-50 would work just fine.

I think it's a good idea!
Abuse is possible but is self-limiting (you'll eventually get mastery 5 on all champs), and it would increase pool variation (for some time we'd see slightly more of the champions that nobody plays).
